Sentencas: A structural model has been developed for analysis of residual stresses for anode- and electrolyte-supported planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: This model was also used for analysis of thermally induced stresses during operation for three different case studies with the electrolyte-supported geometry.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: Temperature distribution in the solid parts of the cell was modeled by means of an in-house electrochemical model, and the results were exported to the structural model.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: In the case studies, the impact of air and fuel inlet temperatures, steam reforming, and operation voltages on thermal stresses were studied.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: Weibull statistics were used for the prediction of failure probabilities and design considerations.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: Base case geometry for the electrolyte-supported cell was 50, 150, and 50 mu m for anode, electrolyte, and cathode thicknesses, respectively, and for the anode-supported cell 1000, 20, and 50 mu m, respectively.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: Analysis of residual stresses showed that, compared with the anode-supported cell, the electrolyte-supported cell experienced considerably higher stress levels in the anode and cathode due to the thick electrolyte, while the stress levels in the electrolyte were lower.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: For the anode-supported cell, maximum stress levels were 57, -12, and -678 MPa in the anode, cathode, and electrolyte, respectively, with negative values indicating compressive and positive values, tensile stresses.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: For the electrolyte-supported geometry, the corresponding levels were 282, 100, and -308 MPa, respectively.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: With a failure probability of 1E-6 and an electrolyte thickness of 10 mu m, the minimum allowable anode thickness was estimated to be 1000 mu m. For an electrolyte-supported cell, optimal thicknesses of electrolyte and anode were considered to be 100 and 100 mu m, respectively, while the thickness of the cathode showed low impact.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: During operation, the stress levels were reduced considerably, since high operating temperatures reduce the temperature difference to the sintering temperature (1250 degrees C).
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: Concerning the presence of methane in the fuel and the effect of steam reforming, small amounts of methane-as low as 10% of molar mass-were found to induce a cooling effect with correspondingly high gradients.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC

Sentencas: With 45% methane in the fuel, the tensile stress level in the anode was about 130 MPa; the impact of thermal gradients was considered to be 40 MPa and the cooling effect also 40 MPa.
Titulo: Analysis of Residual and Operational Thermal Stresses in a Planar SOFC
